turns.content: How many stolen bases did the Brooklyn Dodgers have in the 1955 MLB season?
In the 1955 MLB season, the Brooklyn Dodgers had 90 stolen bases.
That's cool and all, but who were the top three players with the most stolen bases that year for the Dodgers?

I apologize for missing that information. The top three players with the most stolen bases for the Brooklyn Dodgers in the 1955 MLB season were:

1. Pee Wee Reese - 16 stolen bases
2. Jim Gilliam - 13 stolen bases
3. Junior Gilliam - 13 stolen bases
Hmm, interesting. But do you happen to know if any of them got caught stealing during the season?
Yes, I do have that information. In the 1955 MLB season, Pee Wee Reese was caught stealing four times, Jim Gilliam was caught stealing once, and Junior Gilliam was caught stealing twice.
